types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: Organization
types.description: A formal or informal group, or legal organization.

fields.name: image
fields.description: The uri to an image relevant to the agent, such as a logo, avatar, photo, etc.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name that this agent will be referred to by.

fields.name: note
fields.description: A textual description or comment.

fields.name: primaryLocation
fields.description:
The main place an agent is located, often an address where activities occur
and mail can be sent. This is usually a mappable geographic location.  It also
could be a website address, as in the case of agents who have no physical location.

types.name: agentCommitmentSearchParams

types.name: DateTime
types.description:
The `DateTime` scalar type represents a DateTime value as specified by
[ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Commitment
types.description: A planned economic flow that has been promised by an agent to another agent.

fields.name: action
fields.description: Relates a commitment to a verb, such as consume, produce, work, improve, etc.

fields.name: agreedIn
fields.description:
Reference to an agreement between agents which specifies the rules or policies
or calculations which govern this commitment.

fields.name: atLocation
fields.description: The place where a commitment occurs. Usually mappable.

fields.name: clauseOf
fields.description: This commitment is part of the exchange agreement.

fields.name: created
fields.description: The creation time of the commitment.

fields.name: deletable
fields.description: The commitment can be safely deleted, has no dependent information.

fields.name: due
fields.description: The time something is expected to be complete.

fields.name: effortQuantity
fields.description:
The amount and unit of the work or use or citation effort-based action. This
is often a time duration, but also could be cycle counts or other measures of
effort or usefulness.

fields.name: finished
fields.description:
The commitment is complete or not.  This is irrespective of if the original
goal has been met, and indicates that no more will be done.

fields.name: fulfilledBy
fields.description: The economic event which completely or partially fulfills a commitment.

fields.name: hasBeginning
fields.description: The planned beginning of the commitment.

fields.name: hasEnd
fields.description: The planned end of the commitment.

fields.name: hasPointInTime
fields.description: The planned date/time for the commitment. Can be used instead of beginning and end.

fields.name: inScopeOf
fields.description: Grouping around something to create a boundary or context, used for documenting, accounting, planning.

fields.name: independentDemandOf
fields.description: Represents a desired deliverable expected from this plan.

fields.name: inputOf
fields.description: Defines the process to which this commitment is an input.

fields.name: note
fields.description: A textual description or comment.

fields.name: outputOf
fields.description: Defines the process for which this commitment is an output.

fields.name: provider
fields.description: The economic agent from whom the commitment is initiated.

fields.name: receiver
fields.description: The economic agent whom the commitment is for.

fields.name: resourceClassifiedAs
fields.description: References a concept in a common taxonomy or other classification scheme for purposes of categorization or grouping.

fields.name: resourceConformsTo
fields.description:
The primary resource specification or definition of an existing or potential
economic resource. A resource will have only one, as this specifies exactly
what the resource is.

fields.name: resourceInventoriedAs
fields.description: Exact economic resource involved in the commitment.

fields.name: resourceQuantity
fields.description: The amount and unit of the economic resource counted or inventoried.

fields.name: satisfies
fields.description: An intent satisfied fully or partially by an economic event or commitment.

types.name: Action
types.description:
An action verb defining the kind of event, commitment, or intent.
It is recommended that the lowercase action verb should be used as the record ID
in order that references to `Action`s elsewhere in the system are easily readable.

fields.name: inputOutput
fields.description: Denotes if a process input or output, or not related to a process.

fields.name: label
fields.description: A unique verb which defines the action.

fields.name: pairsWith
fields.description: The action that should be included on the other direction of the process, for example accept with modify.

fields.name: resourceEffect
fields.description:
The effect of an economic event on a resource, increment, decrement, no
effect, or decrement resource and increment 'to' resource.

fields.description: A textual description or comment.

types.name: agentEventSearchParams

types.name: EconomicEvent
types.description:
An observed economic flow, as opposed to a flow planned to happen in the future.
This could reflect a change in the quantity of an economic resource. It is also
defined by its behavior in relation to the economic resource (see `Action`)

fields.name: action
fields.description: Relates an economic event to a verb, such as consume, produce, work, improve, etc.

fields.name: agreedIn
fields.description:
Reference to an agreement between agents which specifies the rules or policies
or calculations which govern this economic event.

fields.name: atLocation
fields.description: The place where an economic event occurs.  Usually mappable.

fields.name: deletable
fields.description: The economic event can be safely deleted, has no dependent information.

fields.name: effortQuantity
fields.description:
The amount and unit of the work or use or citation effort-based action. This
is often a time duration, but also could be cycle counts or other measures of
effort or usefulness.

fields.name: fulfills
fields.description: The commitment which is completely or partially fulfilled by an economic event.

fields.name: hasBeginning
fields.description: The beginning of the economic event.

fields.name: hasEnd
fields.description: The end of the economic event.

fields.name: hasPointInTime
fields.description: The date/time at which the economic event occurred. Can be used instead of beginning and end.

fields.name: inScopeOf
fields.description: Grouping around something to create a boundary or context, used for documenting, accounting, planning.

fields.name: inputOf
fields.description: Defines the process to which this event is an input.

fields.name: note
fields.description: A textual description or comment.

fields.name: outputOf
fields.description: Defines the process for which this event is an output.

fields.name: provider
fields.description: The economic agent from whom the actual economic event is initiated.

fields.name: realizationOf
fields.description: This economic event occurs as part of this agreement.

fields.name: receiver
fields.description: The economic agent whom the actual economic event is for.

fields.name: resourceClassifiedAs
fields.description: References a concept in a common taxonomy or other classification scheme for purposes of categorization or grouping.

fields.name: resourceConformsTo
fields.description:
The primary resource specification or definition of an existing or potential
economic resource. A resource will have only one, as this specifies exactly
what the resource is.

fields.name: resourceInventoriedAs
fields.description: Economic resource involved in the economic event.

fields.name: resourceQuantity
fields.description:
The amount and unit of the economic resource counted or inventoried. This is
the quantity that could be used to increment or decrement a resource,
depending on the type of resource and resource effect of action.

fields.name: satisfies
fields.description: An intent satisfied fully or partially by an economic event or commitment.

fields.name: toResourceInventoriedAs
fields.description:
Additional economic resource on the economic event when needed by the
receiver. Used when a transfer or move, or sometimes other actions, requires
explicitly identifying an economic resource on the receiving side.

fields.name: triggeredBy
fields.description: References another economic event that implied this economic event, often based on a prior agreement.

types.name: Appreciation
types.description:
A way to tie an economic event that is given in loose fulfilment for another
economic event, without commitments or expectations.
Supports the gift economy.

fields.name: appreciationOf
fields.description: The economic event this appreciation has been given in acknowledgement of.

fields.name: appreciationWith
fields.description: The economic event provided as a gift in this appreciation.

fields.name: note
fields.description: A textual description or comment.

types.name: Measure
types.description:
Semantic meaning for measurements: binds a quantity to its measurement unit.
See http://www.qudt.org/pages/QUDToverviewPage.html

fields.name: hasNumericalValue
fields.description: A number representing the quantity, will be paired with a unit.

fields.name: hasUnit
fields.description: A unit of measure.

fields.name: symbol

is often a time duration, but also could be cycle counts or other measures of

fields.name: resourceClassifiedAs

The primary resource specification or definition of an existing or potential
economic resource. A resource will have only one, as this specifies exactly
what the resource is.

the quantity that could be used to increment or decrement a resource,

Represents many-to-many relationships between Proposals and Intents, supporting

multiple intents.

fields.name: hasBeginning

fields.name: inScopeOf

types.name: ResourceSpecification
types.description:
Specification of a kind of resource. Could define a material item, service, digital item, currency account, etc.
Used instead of a classification when more information is needed, particularly for recipes.

fields.name: defaultUnitOfEffort
fields.description: [UNSTABLE] The default unit used for quantifying this resource type.

fields.description: A textual description or comment.

types.name: EconomicResource
types.description: A resource which is useful to people or the ecosystem.

fields.name: accountingQuantity
fields.description:
The current amount and unit of the economic resource for which the agent has
primary rights and responsibilities, sometimes thought of as ownership. This
can be either stored or derived from economic events affecting the resource.

fields.name: classifiedAs
fields.description:
References one or more concepts in a common taxonomy or other classification
scheme for purposes of categorization or grouping.

fields.name: conformsTo
fields.description:
The primary resource specification or definition of an existing or potential
economic resource. A resource will have only one, as this specifies exactly
what the resource is.

fields.name: containedIn
fields.description: Used when a stock economic resource contains items also defined as economic resources.

fields.name: contains
fields.description: Used when a stock economic resource contains units also defined as economic resources.

fields.name: currentLocation
fields.description:
The current place an economic resource is located. Could be at any level of
granularity, from a town to an address to a warehouse location. Usually mappable.

fields.name: image
fields.description: The uri to an image relevant to the resource, such as a photo, diagram, etc.

fields.name: lot
fields.description:
Lot or batch of an economic resource, used to track forward or backwards to
all occurrences of resources of that lot. Note more than one resource can be
of the same lot.

fields.name: name
fields.description: An informal or formal textual identifier for an item. Does not imply uniqueness.

fields.name: note
fields.description: A textual description or comment.

fields.name: onhandQuantity
fields.description:
The current amount and unit of the economic resource which is under direct
control of the agent.  It may be more or less than the accounting quantity.
This can be either stored or derived from economic events affecting the resource.

fields.name: primaryAccountable
fields.description:
The agent currently with primary rights and responsibilites for the economic
resource. It is the agent that is associated with the accountingQuantity of
the economic resource.

fields.name: stage
fields.description:
References the ProcessSpecification of the last process the desired economic
resource went through. Stage is used when the last process is important for
finding proper resources, such as where the publishing process wants only
documents that have gone through the editing process.

fields.name: state
fields.description:
The state of the desired economic resource (pass or fail), after coming out of
a test or review process. Can be derived from the last event if a pass or fail event.

fields.name: trackingIdentifier
fields.description:
Sometimes called serial number, used when each item must have a traceable
identifier (like a computer). Could also be used for other unique tracking
identifiers needed for resources.

fields.name: unitOfEffort
fields.description: The unit used for use or work or cite actions for this resource.

fields.name: expiryDate
fields.description: Expiration date of the batch, commonly used for food.

fields.name: productionDate
fields.description: Date the batch was produced.  Can be derived from the economic event of production.

fields.description: An intent satisfied fully or partially by an economic event or commitment.

types.name: Cursor
types.description:
An opaque position marker for pagination. Paginated queries return
a PageInfo struct with start and end cursors (which are actually
lists of Cursor for ...reasons...). You can then issue queries
requesting results `before` the `start` or `after` the `end`
cursors to request the previous or next page respectively.

Is actually a string or integer. May be extended in future.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax (as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).
